data.title: Team Home Webster Groves Statesmen Sports
data.meta_description: Follow the  Statesmen schedule, roster, events and photos all in one place.
data.text:
The 23rd annual Webster Classic varsity boys basketball tournament tipped off last night in Roberts Gymnasium at Webster Groves High School. The second round action will start today at 4:00 with John Burroughs vs. McCluer North followed by Jennings vs. Lee’s Summit North at 5:30. The championship semifinals will feature Webster Groves vs. St. Mary’s

The Turkey Day Game – 50 Years Ago (1973) The Story of the 1973 Turkey Day Game. Shawn Greene,Community Contributor Posted Sun, Nov 19, 2023 at 5:22 pm CT|Updated Sun, Nov 19, 2023 at 6:06 pm CT There is nothing worse than a drought of Turkey Day Game wins. Since 1968, Webster had been the victor in

WGHS Athletic Director Jerry Collins will be retiring at the end of the school year after having served the Webster Groves School District for the last 24 years with the past 19 as the school’s Athletic Director. During Mr. Collins’ tenure as A.D. the Statesmen have seen unparalleled success. Webster Groves teams have won 11

The WGHS Boys Swimming and Diving team placed 6th in the 2023 Class 1 State Championship meet on November 9th and 10th at the St. Peters Rec-Plex for their best finish in the state meet since placing 4th back in 1971. The boys earned state medals in five different events led by junior Emmett Shank

The WGHS Cross Country teams had their best day in years at the MSHSAA Class 4 State Championship meet on Saturday, November 4th at the Gans Creek Course in Columbia. The boys team was led by junior Dominic Buckman who earned a state medal by placing 12th individually. As a team the boys placed 4th

By Miki McKee Koelsch as published online by the Webster-Kirkwood Times. The swim and dive teams of Webster Groves, Kirkwood and St. John Vianney high schools all recently wrapped up boast-worthy seasons.
